simple.name: global_group_id
simple.description: Any allocations requested on this device must have a matching group_id field (ie - the group_id value defined in the allocation structure must match the group_id for the device). These values default to an empty string and therefore match by default. Please see the Frontend Interfaces v2.0 documentation for a full description.

simple.name: device_kind
simple.description: This specifies the device kind

simple.name: device_model
simple.description: This specifies the specific device

structsequence.name: frontend_tuner_status
structsequence.description: Status of each tuner, including entries for both allocated and un-allocated tuners. Each entry represents a single tuner.

simple.name: allocation_id_csv
simple.description: Comma separated list of current Allocation IDs.

simple.name: bandwidth
simple.description: Current bandwidth in Hz

simple.name: center_frequency
simple.description: Current center frequency in Hz.

simple.name: enabled
simple.description: Indicates if tuner is enabled, in reference to the output state of the tuner.

simple.name: group_id
simple.description: Unique ID that specifies a group of Device.

simple.name: rf_flow_id
simple.description: Specifies a certain RF flow to allocate against.

simple.name: sample_rate
simple.description: Current sample rate in samples per second.

simple.name: tuner_type
simple.description: Example Tuner Types: TX, RX, CHANNELIZER, DDC, RX_DIGITIZER, RX_DIGTIZIER_CHANNELIZER

struct.name: frontend_listener_allocation
struct.description: Frontend Interfaces v2 listener allocation structure

struct.name: frontend_tuner_allocation
struct.description: Frontend Interfaces v2 main allocation structure

simple.name: tuner_type
simple.description: Example Tuner Types: TX, RX, CHANNELIZER, DDC, RX_DIGITIZER, RX_DIGTIZIER_CHANNELIZER

simple.name: allocation_id
simple.description: The allocation_id set by the caller. Used by the caller to reference the allocation uniquely

simple.name: center_frequency
simple.description: Requested center frequency

simple.name: bandwidth
simple.description: Requested bandwidth (+/- the tolerance)

simple.name: bandwidth_tolerance
simple.description: Allowable Percent above requested bandwidth (ie - 100 would be up to twice)

simple.name: sample_rate
simple.description: Requested sample rate (+/- the tolerance). This can be ignored for such devices as analog tuners

simple.name: sample_rate_tolerance
simple.description: Allowable Percent above requested sample rate (ie - 100 would be up to twice)

simple.name: device_control
simple.description: True: Has control over the device to make changes False: Does not need control and can just attach to any currently tasked device that satisfies the parameters (essentually a listener)

simple.name: group_id
simple.description: Unique identifier that specifies the group a device must be in. Must match group_id on the device

simple.name: rf_flow_id
simple.description: Optional. Specifies the RF flow of a specific input source to allocate against. If left empty, it will match all FrontEnd devices.

simple.name: filter_fir_config
simple.description: Complete name of the file with filter configuration

simple.name: dcxo_tune_coarse
simple.description: Digital Controlled Crystal Oscillator Tuning sets a coarse capacitor value *This feature does not exist on the AD9363

simple.name: dcxo_tune_fine
simple.description: Digital Controlled Crystal Oscillator Tuning sets a fine capacitor value *This feature does not exist on the AD9363

simple.name: xo_correction
simple.description: Digital correction for the oscillator offset, by telling the system the actual oscillator

simple.name: filter_fir_en
simple.description: Enable or Disable the RX or TX path filters

simple.name: rf_bandwidth
simple.description: RX RF Bandwidth Control

simple.name: sampling_frequency
simple.description: Sets the RX Sample Rate

simple.name: frequency
simple.description: RX Local Oscillator Control

simple.name: rx_lo_external
simple.description: External LO Support *This feature does not exist on the AD9363

simple.name: rf_port_select
simple.description: RF port used by the receive chain

simple.name: quadrature_tracking_en
simple.description: Calibration Tracking Controls

simple.name: rf_dc_offset_tracking_en
simple.description: Calibration Tracking Controls

simple.name: bb_dc_offset_tracking_en
simple.description: Calibration Tracking Controls

simple.name: rx1_hardwaregain
simple.description: sets the current Gain for RX1 only if Gain Control Mode is Manual

simple.name: rx1_gain_control_mode
simple.description: Sets a Gain Control Mode for RX1

simple.name: rx2_hardwaregain
simple.description: sets the current Gain for RX2 only if Gain Control Mode is Manual *This feature does not exist on the AD9364

simple.name: rx2_gain_control_mode
simple.description: Sets a Gain Control Mode for RX2 *This feature does not exist on the AD9364

simple.name: rf_bandwidth
simple.description: TX RF Bandwidth Control

simple.name: sampling_frequency
simple.description: Sets the TX Sample Rate

simple.name: frequency
simple.description: TX Local Oscillator Control

simple.name: tx_lo_external
simple.description: External LO Support *This feature does not exist on the AD9363

simple.name: rf_port_select
simple.description: RF port used by the transmit chain

simple.name: tx1_hardwaregain
simple.description: Tx Attenuation Control for TX1

simple.name: tx2_hardwaregain
simple.description: Tx Attenuation Control for TX2 *This feature does not exist on the AD9364

struct.name: target_device
struct.description: Information used to specify a particular AD936x device to target.

simple.name: name
simple.description: Name of the AD836X device

simple.name: serial
simple.description: Serial number of the AD936X device
